image.altText: A black and white printed photo strips of a man with glasses and wavy hair.

props.synopsis: For 50 years and before his death earlier this year, Alan Adler worked alone to keep the historic Flinders Street Station photo booth up and running.

title.children: Alan Adler worked alone for 50 years to keep Melbourne's photo booths open

image.altText: GettyImages-2218919868

props.synopsis: Erin Phillips and Daisy Pearce become the first AFLW players to be inducted into the Australian Football Hall of Fame.

title.children: Footy star's emotional Hall of Fame speech leaves father in tears

image.altText: A close up of an embryo being created with scientific equipment in a lab.

props.synopsis: In an announcement to the ASX on Tuesday morning, Monash IVF said the incident happened on June 5 at its laboratory in Clayton, Melbourne.

title.children: Fertility group transfers wrong embryo for second time

image.altText: McLaren's Lando Norris, McLaren's Oscar Piastri, Red Bull's Max Verstappen and drivers in action at the start of the race.

props.synopsis: Formula 1's new era will begin in Melbourne after the Australian Grand Prix was confirmed as the first race of the 2026 season.

title.children: F1's new era to begin at Australian Grand Prix with first race of 2026

image.altText: Man with a fringe looks into the camera wearing a COVID mask with a tiger on it.

props.synopsis: A disgraced school teacher who fled interstate has been jailed for sexually abusing young girls in Gippsland in the 1980s.

title.children: Paedophile teacher abused girl in presence of other students

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: In a tense morning of questioning, accused murderer Erin Patterson says multiple witnesses who have given evidence during her trial have been mistaken.

title.children: Erin Patterson disputes testimony of witnesses and family in mushroom murder trial

image.altText: Casey Kopua of the Giants attempts to block a shot

props.synopsis: Although most fans lost their minds at the sight of Kiwi legend Casey Kopua on a Super Netball court, some keyboard warriors were critical that she'd taken a pathway player's spot.

title.children: Kopua ignores keyboard warriors to inspire Giants in upset over defending premiers

image.altText: Police Senior Sergeant Luke Banwell

props.synopsis: Police say an 18-year-old male driver and and his 15-year-old male passenger were in a car that lost control on a wet road then hit a tree.

title.children: Two teenagers killed in crash at Orbost in Victoria's east

image.altText: A family stands next to a dam with some water in it on a farm.

props.synopsis: Victorian farmers breathed a sigh of relief across the weekend as much-needed rain fell across the state.

title.children: 'Grinning our heads off': Farmers ecstatic after much-needed rains

image.altText: REA logo outside their office is of a red and white arrow going up

props.synopsis: It can cost thousands to list a property online for sale. The competition regulator has stepped in after years of complaints that REA Group is using its dominant position to the detriment of home sellers and real estate agents.

title.children: 'Complete market saturation': Real estate listings giant faces probe

image.altText: Bushwalkers were stranded in wild weather near Mt Kosciuszko

props.synopsis: Hikers visiting the alps are being urged to take the necessary precautions after a series of rescues in NSW and Victoria.

title.children: Couple stranded in blizzard rescued in 20-hour operation

image.altText: A flowering tobacco plant in a field.

props.synopsis: Authorities seize a 20-tonne crop of mature tobacco being grown on 2.4 hectares, an area equivalent to more than 100 tennis courts, in Victoria's north.

title.children: Illicit tobacco crop worth $4.4m discovered near Shepparton after tip-off

image.altText: A woman in a lab coat holds a blood sample in a laboratory.

props.synopsis: Patients have to eat gluten for weeks before the current coeliac disease test, even when it makes them ill, but Australian researchers believe they have found a better method.

title.children: 'Life-changing' test developed for people allergic to gluten

image.altText: A large air duct fallen to the ground in an industrial building.

props.synopsis: Yallourn Power Station, considered the region's most unreliable, has been forced to put one of its units offline for weeks after an air duct collapsed.

title.children: Worksafe investigating air duct collapse at Gippsland power station

image.altText: A male ABC presenter stands behind a table in a hay shed. He's wearing headphones and is hoping a microphone.

props.synopsis: Victorian Country Hour host Warwick Long reflects on how farmers focus on mental health, modern farming practices and climate change preparation.

title.children: Victoria is in the grip of drought, but what's different about this one?

image.altText: A Rolled over car

props.synopsis: Emergency services spent the weekend rescuing people trapped in cars in Victoria's high country. Here's how to stay safe up the mountain.

title.children: How to avoid getting your car stuck on snowy roads this winter

image.altText: Max Gawn pushes teammate Steven May after a conversation

props.synopsis: Max Gawn is not impressed with some instant feedback from teammate Steven May after a costly late turnover in Melbourne's one-point loss to Collingwood at the MCG.

title.children: Melbourne stars in fiery clash after losing thriller to Collingwood

image.altText: A woman clasps her hand in front of her face in front of a mirror

props.synopsis: Last year, more than 1,700 orders for involuntary electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) were approved by tribunals in Australia. Advocacy groups say clinicians need to be better informed.

title.children: Thousands of Australians receiving ECT without consent every year

image.altText: A black and brown puppy held by a boy

props.synopsis: Downpours during the Australian Kelpie Muster bring smiles, not scowls, to a drought-stricken town in western Victoria.

title.children: Tails wag at kelpie muster as rain drenches town ravaged by drought

image.altText: Baz Luhrmann wearing a dark green and silver suit and Catherine Martin in a dark green long sleeve dress with silver flowers

props.synopsis: Some 830 Australians will be recognised as part of the King's Birthday 2025 honours on Monday, including film director Baz Luhrmann and his frequent collaborator Catherine Martin, an award-winning costume, production and set designer.

title.children: King's Birthday honours list includes Hollywood heavyweights, local heroes

image.altText: Photo of All Are Welcome bakery window with a building reflected in the glass.

props.synopsis: Melbourne bakery workers are likely to be thousands of dollars out-of-pocket in unpaid super entitlements. Could a new law have protected them?

title.children: 'Payday super' means you'll get your super when you get your wages

image.altText: A composite photo of Victorian opposition leader John Pesutto and former Liberal MP Moira Deeming.

props.synopsis: So much of politics is the art of compromise. It's an art form the Victorian Liberals are unwilling to practice as the party once again rips itself apart over the fate of former leader John Pesutto.

title.children: As John Pesutto faces bankruptcy, the Victorian Liberals can't compromise

image.altText: Kingsley and Phil smile while having a conversation outside.

props.synopsis: When fire on opposite sides of Australia destroyed two of the country's most unique native plant gardens it was the start of two rebuilds – and one extraordinary friendship.

title.children: Friendship forged as two men rebuild their gardens after bushfire

image.altText: Two men wrestle on inside a UFC octagon. Seen through the wire of its fence, one man straddles the other.

props.synopsis: Beneath the profitable success story of the UFC lies a hidden reality: many athletes who have dedicated their careers to the sport are struggling and are unable to fight back.

title.children: Tyson was 'willing to die' for the UFC. He changed his mind after getting paid

image.altText: Generic disposable coffee cup held in a hand with beach in background.

props.synopsis: US tariffs and supply issues are creating uncertainty for an already strained coffee market, and roasters say it's only a matter of time before Australians will pay more for their brew.

title.children: Coffee prices up to $12 needed to make industry viable, supplier says

image.altText: Four people inside a tram making silly expressions, wearing blue school uniforms.

props.synopsis: From independent theatre La Mama to off-Broadway, queer satire Trophy Boys has taken off with its exploration of misogyny and masculinity, through drag and debating.

title.children: Why this queer satire is resonating with audiences — and plenty of mums

image.altText: The entrance to CS Square shopping centre, with a pedestrian crossing out the front.

props.synopsis: A group of males armed with machetes have argued inside shopping centre in Melbourne's west, prompting a police investigation.

title.children: Shopping centre worker felt 'terrified' during second machete incident

image.altText: A sketch of Erin Patterson wearing a blue jumper and thin framed black glasses with her hair tied back.

props.synopsis: The 50-year-old, who has pleaded not guilty to three charges of murder and one of attempted murder, admitted several times she had used lies and exaggeration in the past.

title.children: Erin Patterson's week on the stand in her mushroom murder trial

image.altText: a bunch of grapes on a vine in sunlight

props.synopsis: Cotton Candy, Fire Crush, and Midnight Beauty are among a variety of new grapes making their way into Australian supermarkets as growers race to keep up with consumer demand.

title.children: Why you're seeing new grape varieties at the supermarket

image.altText: Paul McDonald starting an auger

props.synopsis: The effects of drought creep insidiously into every corner of a country Victorian community.

title.children: Drought devastates farming town desperate for rain relief

image.altText: A young woman, smiling, and kicking up snow.

props.synopsis: Alpine resorts could not be happier with up to 19 centimetres of fresh snow recorded overnight — and more snow to come.

title.children: Fresh snow marks the official opening of the Victorian ski season

image.altText: Front of the Licola General Store with the 50 year old sign of the shop with chickens at the top

props.synopsis: Nestled beside picturesque Macalister River, Victoria's only privately owned town is a popular stop on the way to the high country. But Licola village operators say staff have been threatened over plans by management.

title.children: Claims of intimidation, threats over big changes in tiny town

image.altText: A birdseye view of a house submerged under flood water.

props.synopsis: An independent flood study flagging high-risk areas in Victoria's south-west is abandoned after councillors decide they do not trust the data.

title.children: Council cans peer-reviewed flood study, citing 'supposed science'
